title: SLASH 6
data:
**SLASH 6** was the last of six releases of [SLASH](/wiki/SLASH "SLASH") that were based on [NetHack 3.1.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.1.3 "NetHack 3.1.3"), and incorporates a combination of features from [NetHack Plus](/wiki/NetHack_Plus "NetHack Plus") and both versions of [NetHack--](/wiki/NetHack-- "NetHack--").

[ ]

- [2 The adventurer](#The_adventurer)

## Availability

The source code is archived on [Ali Harlow](/wiki/Ali_Harlow "Ali Harlow")'s website at [juiblex.co](http://www.juiblex.co.uk/nethack/source/slashsr6.zip). It includes only the files needed to build for [MS-DOS](/wiki/MS-DOS "MS-DOS") on the old Watcom compiler; it might be possible to build with [Open Watcom](http://www.openwatcom.org/) after tweaking the code (it doesn't compile as is).

Various obscure FTP sites have binaries and earlier versions.

## The adventurer

SLASH 6 inherits the twelve roles of [NetHack 3.1.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.1.3 "NetHack 3.1.3") and six roles from [NetHack Plus](/wiki/NetHack_Plus "NetHack Plus"), and adds two of its own; it also allows certain roles to have the player's choice of [alignment](/wiki/Alignment "Alignment"), something new at that time:

| Role          | Alignment          | Pet                          | Origin       | Notes                       |
| ------------- | ------------------ | ---------------------------- | ------------ | --------------------------- |
| Archeologist  | Lawful or Neutral  | kitten or little dog         | Vanilla      | Lawful in vanilla           |
| Barbarian     | Neutral or Chaotic | kitten or little dog         | Vanilla      | Neutral in vanilla          |
| Cave(wo)man   | Lawful or Neutral  | little dog                   | Vanilla      | Lawful in vanilla           |
| Doppelganger  | Any                | kitten or little dog         | NetHack Plus | Chaotic in NH+              |
| Elf           | Any                | kitten or little dog         | Vanilla      | Chaotic in vanilla          |
| Flame Mage    | Neutral            | baby red dragon              | NetHack Plus |                             |
| Gnome         | Lawful or Neutral  | giant badger                 | new          |                             |
| Healer        | Lawful or Neutral  | kitten, little dog, or snake | Vanilla      | Neutral in vanilla          |
| Ice Mage      | Neutral            | baby white dragon            | NetHack Plus |                             |
| Knight        | Lawful             | kitten or little dog         | Vanilla      |                             |
| Lycanthrope   | Chaotic            | wolf                         | NetHack Plus |                             |
| Monk          | Neutral            | kitten or little dog         | NetHack Plus |                             |
| Necromancer   | Chaotic            | ghoul                        | new          |                             |
| Priest(ess)   | Any                | kitten or little dog         | Vanilla      | Random alignment in vanilla |
| Rogue         | Neutral or Chaotic | kitten or giant rat          | Vanilla      | Chaotic in vanilla          |
| Samurai       | Lawful             | little dog                   | Vanilla      |                             |
| Tourist       | Lawful or Neutral  | kitten or little dog         | Vanilla      | Neutral in vanilla          |
| Undead Slayer | Lawful             | kitten or little dog         | NetHack Plus |                             |
| Valkyrie      | Neutral or Chaotic | kitten or little dog         | Vanilla      | Neutral in vanilla          |
| Wizard        | Neutral            | kitten or bat                | Vanilla      |                             |

All classes permit male and female adventurers, except the [Valkyrie](/wiki/Valkyrie "Valkyrie") which must be female. Chaotic elves are called *drow* and get a different [Quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") from lawful or neutral ones.

## Dungeon features

### Levels and branches

The [Dungeons of Doom](/wiki/Dungeons_of_Doom "Dungeons of Doom") are lengthened, to accommodate a number of new levels and branches, all of which are new to SLASH:

- A possible [mall](/wiki/Mall "Mall") level, containing numerous [shops](/wiki/Shop "Shop").
- [The Orc Caverns](/index.php?title=The_Orc_Caverns\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "The Orc Caverns (page does not exist)").
- [The Beholder Cave](/wiki/Neutral_quest "Neutral quest").
- [The Lost Tomb](/wiki/The_Lost_Tomb "The Lost Tomb").
- [The Sunless Sea](/wiki/The_Sunless_Sea "The Sunless Sea").
- [The Spider Caves](/wiki/The_Spider_Caves "The Spider Caves").
- [The Temple of Moloch](/wiki/The_Temple_of_Moloch "The Temple of Moloch"). *(this is distinct from the [Sanctum](/wiki/Sanctum "Sanctum"))*
- [The Giant Caverns](/wiki/The_Giant_Caverns "The Giant Caverns").
- A level with lots of [rats](/wiki/Rat "Rat") and the [Rat King](/wiki/Rat_King "Rat King").
- A level with lots of [kobolds](/wiki/Kobold_\(monster_class\) "Kobold (monster class)") and the [Kobold King](/wiki/Kroo_the_Kobold_King "Kroo the Kobold King").
- A [storage level](/wiki/Storage_level "Storage level").
- A level with lots of [nymphs](/wiki/Nymph "Nymph") and [Aphrodite](/wiki/Aphrodite "Aphrodite").
- [The Guild of Disgruntled Adventurers](/wiki/The_Guild_of_Disgruntled_Adventurers "The Guild of Disgruntled Adventurers").
- A level with lots of [liches](/wiki/Lich "Lich").

Code is present to implement the [black market](/wiki/Black_market_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Black market (SLASH'EM)"), inherited from [NetHack Plus](/wiki/NetHack_Plus "NetHack Plus"), and for [The Wyrm Caves](/wiki/The_Wyrm_Caves "The Wyrm Caves"), but is commented out.

[Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom") is shortened, to reduce the number of [mazes](/wiki/Maze "Maze"), and [Yeenoghu](/wiki/Yeenoghu "Yeenoghu"), [Demogorgon](/wiki/Demogorgon "Demogorgon"), [Geryon](/wiki/Geryon "Geryon"), and [Dispater](/wiki/Dispater "Dispater") are all given lairs.

### Rooms

New [special rooms](/wiki/Special_room "Special room") are:

| Type                                                        | Origin    |
| ----------------------------------------------------------- | --------- |
| [giant court](/wiki/Giant_court "Giant court")              | NetHack-- |
| [leprechaun court](/wiki/Leprechaun_hall "Leprechaun hall") | NetHack-- |
| [bad food shop](/wiki/Bad_food_shop "Bad food shop")        | NetHack-- |
| [real zoo](/wiki/Real_zoo "Real zoo")                       | NetHack-- |
| [anthill](/wiki/Anthole "Anthole")                          | NetHack-- |
| [dragon lair](/wiki/Dragon_lair "Dragon lair")              | new       |
| [cockatrice nest](/wiki/Cockatrice_nest "Cockatrice nest")  | new       |

The bad food shop is not a shop in the usual sense. The wasp hive and "Room 11" from NetHack-- were removed.

There is one additional type of [shop](/wiki/Shop "Shop"), a [pet shop](/wiki/Pet_shop "Pet shop") inherited from NetHack Plus.

### Traps and fixtures

The optional water weird fountain from [NetHack Plus](/wiki/NetHack_Plus "NetHack Plus") was removed. New fixtures, all new to SLASH, are the [grave](/wiki/Grave "Grave") and the [toilet](/wiki/Toilet "Toilet").

SLASH 6 adds no new [traps](/wiki/Trap "Trap") to [NetHack 3.1.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.1.3 "NetHack 3.1.3").

## The bestiary

html:
SLASH 6

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

SLASH 6 was the last of six releases of SLASH that were based on NetHack 3.1.3, and incorporates a combination of features from NetHack Plus and both versions of NetHack--.

Contents

  • 1 Availability
  • 2 The adventurer
  • 3 Dungeon features
    • 3.1 Levels and branches
    • 3.2 Rooms
    • 3.3 Traps and fixtures
  • 4 The bestiary
  • 5 Objects
    • 5.1 Artifacts
    • 5.2 Amulets
    • 5.3 Food
    • 5.4 Weapons
    • 5.5 Tools
    • 5.6 Armor
    • 5.7 Potions
    • 5.8 Scrolls
    • 5.9 Wands
    • 5.10 Spellbooks
    • 5.11 Rings
    • 5.12 Stones

Availability

The source code is archived on Ali Harlow's website at juiblex.co. It includes only the files needed to build for MS-DOS on the old Watcom compiler; it might be possible to build with Open Watcom after tweaking the code (it doesn't compile as is).

Various obscure FTP sites have binaries and earlier versions.

The adventurer

SLASH 6 inherits the twelve roles of NetHack 3.1.3 and six roles from NetHack Plus, and adds two of its own; it also allows certain roles to have the player's choice of alignment, something new at that time:

Role Alignment Pet Origin Notes
Archeologist Lawful or Neutral kitten or little dog Vanilla Lawful in vanilla
Barbarian Neutral or Chaotic kitten or little dog Vanilla Neutral in vanilla
Cave(wo)man Lawful or Neutral little dog Vanilla Lawful in vanilla
Doppelganger Any kitten or little dog NetHack Plus Chaotic in NH+
Elf Any kitten or little dog Vanilla Chaotic in vanilla
Flame Mage Neutral baby red dragon NetHack Plus
Gnome Lawful or Neutral giant badger new
Healer Lawful or Neutral kitten, little dog, or snake Vanilla Neutral in vanilla
Ice Mage Neutral baby white dragon NetHack Plus
Knight Lawful kitten or little dog Vanilla
Lycanthrope Chaotic wolf NetHack Plus
Monk Neutral kitten or little dog NetHack Plus
Necromancer Chaotic ghoul new
Priest(ess) Any kitten or little dog Vanilla Random alignment in vanilla
Rogue Neutral or Chaotic kitten or giant rat Vanilla Chaotic in vanilla
Samurai Lawful little dog Vanilla
Tourist Lawful or Neutral kitten or little dog Vanilla Neutral in vanilla
Undead Slayer Lawful kitten or little dog NetHack Plus
Valkyrie Neutral or Chaotic kitten or little dog Vanilla Neutral in vanilla
Wizard Neutral kitten or bat Vanilla

All classes permit male and female adventurers, except the Valkyrie which must be female. Chaotic elves are called drow and get a different Quest from lawful or neutral ones.

Dungeon features

Levels and branches

The Dungeons of Doom are lengthened, to accommodate a number of new levels and branches, all of which are new to SLASH:

  • A possible mall level, containing numerous shops.
  • The Orc Caverns.
  • The Beholder Cave.
  • The Lost Tomb.
  • The Sunless Sea.
  • The Spider Caves.
  • The Temple of Moloch. (this is distinct from the Sanctum)
  • The Giant Caverns.
  • A level with lots of rats and the Rat King.
  • A level with lots of kobolds and the Kobold King.
  • A storage level.
  • A level with lots of nymphs and Aphrodite.
  • The Guild of Disgruntled Adventurers.
  • A level with lots of liches.

Code is present to implement the black market, inherited from NetHack Plus, and for The Wyrm Caves, but is commented out.

Gehennom is shortened, to reduce the number of mazes, and Yeenoghu, Demogorgon, Geryon, and Dispater are all given lairs.

Rooms

New special rooms are:

Type Origin
giant court NetHack--
leprechaun court NetHack--
bad food shop NetHack--
real zoo NetHack--
anthill NetHack--
dragon lair new
cockatrice nest new

The bad food shop is not a shop in the usual sense. The wasp hive and "Room 11" from NetHack-- were removed.

There is one additional type of shop, a pet shop inherited from NetHack Plus.

Traps and fixtures

The optional water weird fountain from NetHack Plus was removed. New fixtures, all new to SLASH, are the grave and the toilet.

SLASH 6 adds no new traps to NetHack 3.1.3.

The bestiary

Most monsters that had their appearances changed in NetHack-- 3.1.3 are restored to their appearances in NetHack-- 3.0.10.

Monsters in SLASH, in addition to those in vanilla NetHack 3.1.3, are:

Name Appearance Origin Notes
snow ant a NetHack-- 3.1.3
yellow jacket a NetHack-- 3.1.3
tsetse fly a new
giant wasp a NetHack-- 3.1.3 Formerly a
black wasp a NetHack-- 3.1.3
army ant a new
spitting beetle a new

It should be noted here that spells in SLASH 6 (as in NetHack 3.1.3) work rather like wands, having a limited number of charges per read of a spellbook, and that spellbooks can only be read once. rawPage:
'''SLASH 6''' was the last of six releases of [[SLASH]] that were based on [[NetHack 3.1.3]], and incorporates a combination of features from [[NetHack Plus]] and both versions of [[NetHack--]].

== Availability ==

The source code is archived on [[Ali Harlow]]'s website at [http://www.juiblex.co.uk/nethack/source/slashsr6.zip juiblex.co]. It includes only the files needed to build for [[MS-DOS]] on the old Watcom compiler; it might be possible to build with [http://www.openwatcom.org/ Open Watcom] after tweaking the code (it doesn't compile as is).

Various obscure FTP sites have binaries and earlier versions.

== The adventurer ==

SLASH 6 inherits the twelve roles of [[NetHack 3.1.3]] and six roles from [[NetHack Plus]], and adds two of its own; it also allows certain roles to have the player's choice of [[alignment]], something new at that time:

All classes permit male and female adventurers, except the [[Valkyrie]] which must be female.  Chaotic elves are called ''drow'' and get a different [[Quest]] from lawful or neutral ones.

== Dungeon features ==

=== Levels and branches ===
The [[Dungeons of Doom]] are lengthened, to accommodate a number of new levels and branches, all of which are new to SLASH:

* A possible [[mall]] level, containing numerous [[shop]]s.
* [[The Orc Caverns]].
* [[Neutral quest|The Beholder Cave]].
* [[The Lost Tomb]].
* [[The Sunless Sea]].
* [[The Spider Caves]].
* [[The Temple of Moloch]]. ''(this is distinct from the [[Sanctum]])''
* [[The Giant Caverns]].
* A level with lots of [[rat]]s and the [[Rat King]].
* A level with lots of [[Kobold (monster class)|kobolds]] and the [[Kroo the Kobold King|Kobold King]].
* A [[storage level]].
* A level with lots of [[nymph]]s and [[Aphrodite]].
* [[The Guild of Disgruntled Adventurers]].
* A level with lots of [[lich]]es.

Code is present to implement the [[Black market (SLASH'EM)|black market]], inherited from [[NetHack Plus]], and for [[The Wyrm Caves]], but is commented out.

[[Gehennom]] is shortened, to reduce the number of [[maze]]s, and [[Yeenoghu]], [[Demogorgon]], [[Geryon]], and [[Dispater]] are all given lairs.

=== Rooms ===

The bad food shop is not a shop in the usual sense. The wasp hive and "Room 11" from NetHack-- were removed.

There is one additional type of [[shop]], a [[pet shop]] inherited from NetHack Plus.

=== Traps and fixtures ===
The optional water weird fountain from [[NetHack Plus]] was removed.  New fixtures, all new to SLASH, are the [[grave]] and the [[toilet]].

SLASH 6 adds no new [[trap]]s to [[NetHack 3.1.3]].

== The bestiary ==

Most monsters that had their appearances changed in [[NetHack-- 3.1.3]] are restored to their appearances in [[NetHack-- 3.0.10]].

It should be noted here that spells in SLASH 6 (as in NetHack 3.1.3) work rather like wands, having a limited number of charges per read of a spellbook, and that spellbooks can only be read once. Many of these spells, among them enlighten, enchant armor, and enchant weapon, would be unbalancing if combined with the [[Wizard Patch|modern spellcasting system]].
